      • withLookupResolver

        public ThymeleafBuilder withLookupResolver(String lookup,
                                           org.thymeleaf.templateresolver.ITemplateResolver resolver)

        Registers a new custom Thymeleaf resolver for the lookup. If a resolver was already registered for the same lookup, the provided resolver will replace it.

        It doesn't use the general abstraction mechanism. So be sure to use it correctly.

        Parameters:
        lookup - the lookup prefix (without the ':' character)
        resolver - the Thymealeaf specific resolver
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • withTemplateEngine

        public ThymeleafBuilder withTemplateEngine(org.thymeleaf.TemplateEngine engine)
        By default the builder uses the default Thymeleaf template engine as-is.
        Parameters:
        engine - the new Thymeleaf template engine
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • withPrefix

        public ThymeleafBuilder withPrefix(String prefix)
        Description copied from interface: TemplateParserBuilder
        Set the prefix for template lookup. This prefix is used for all lookup methods. The aim is to define only the name of the template (or a subset) and the system will find it for you. It avoids to explicitly write the whole path and let you change the lookup method easily. For example:
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/createAccount.html
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/resetPassword.html
        So you can set the prefix to /foo/template/ and then reference the templates using the file name:
        • createAccount.html
        • resetPassword.html
        Specified by:
        withPrefix in interface TemplateParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix for template resolution
        Returns:
        The current builder for fluent use

      • withSuffix

        public ThymeleafBuilder withSuffix(String suffix)
        Description copied from interface: TemplateParserBuilder
        Set the suffix for template lookup. This suffix is used for all lookup methods. The aim is to define only the name of the template (or a subset) and the system will find it for you. It avoids to explicitly write the whole path and let you change the lookup method easily. For example:
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/createAccount.html
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/resetPassword.html
        So you can set the prefix to /foo/template/, the suffix to .html and then reference the templates using the file name:
        • createAccount
        • resetPassword
        Specified by:
        withSuffix in interface TemplateParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        suffix - the suffix for template resolution
        Returns:
        The current builder for fluent use

      • registerResolverAdapter

        public ThymeleafBuilder registerResolverAdapter(ThymeleafResolverAdapter adapter)
        Registers a new template resolver adapter. An adapter is used for transforming the general resolver into a Thymeleaf specific equivalent.
        Parameters:
        adapter - the adapter to register
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • withLookupResolver

        public TemplateParserBuilder withLookupResolver(String lookup,
                                                ResourceResolver resolver)
        Description copied from interface: TemplateParserBuilder
        Register a lookup resolver. The lookup is like JNDI lookup. It indicates using a simple string how to handle the provided path or URL. For example:
        • "classpath:/foo" indicates that the provided path represents a classpath entry.
        • "file:/tmp" indicates that the provided path represents a file located on the system.
        Specified by:
        withLookupResolver in interface TemplateParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        lookup - the lookup name (without the : character)
        resolver - the resolver implementation
        Returns:
        The current builder for fluent use

      • getEngine

        public org.thymeleaf.TemplateEngine getEngine()
        Give access to the Thymeleaf template engine in order to be able to customize it.
        Returns:
        Thymeleaf template engine
